unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Probability from a Table: Place of Birth
question_text: The human resources department at a small local company compiled information about where employees of the company were born.  This information is shown in the table below. Born In-State Born in a  Different State Born in a Different Country Total Women 23 16 3 42 Men 19 24 5 48 Total 42 40 8 90 If $2\text{ employees}$ are randomly selected from the employees at this company, what is the probability that neither employee was born in-state?
